p: Agricultural lands occupy approximately 38% of the Earth’s land surface [ 1]. These croplands and pastures presently cover about 10%, 45% and 27% of the areas originally occupied by boreal, temperate, and tropical forests respectively [ 1– 4]. Population growth and the associated expansion of agricultural lands is the primary cause of present day deforestation [ 4, 5]. Although rates of deforestation have decreased over the last decade, the loss of forested areas is expected to continue during the present century [ 6, 7]. Forested area in the Amazon Basin, where the largest rainforest on Earth is found, could be reduced in approximately 50% by 2050. [ 6– 8].
